div.l: In stede of floure yet wole I yeue hem bren

l.hi: The grettest Clerkys ne be nat wysest men

div.l: As whilom to the wolfe thus spake the mare
Of alle hire arte counte I nat a tare
Out at the dore he goth full priuely
When that he saugh hys tyme full softely
He loketh vp and doun / til he hath founde
The Clerkys hors / ther as it stode y bounde
Byhynde the Mille vndir a leefsele
And to the hors he goth hym faire and wele
He strepith of the bridel right a noon
And whan the hors was lous / he gynneth goon
Toward the fenne there wilde mares renne
And forthwith wehe / thurgh thykke and thourgh thenne
This Millere goth a gayn / no worde he seyde
But doth his note / and with the clerkys pleyde
Til that hire corn / was faire and wele y grounde
And whan the mele is sakked and y bounde
This Iohn oute and fynt his hors a way
And gan to crye / harrowe and weillaway
Oure hors is lost Aleyn for goddis banes
Step on thy feet · com out man al at anes
Allas oure wardeyn / hath his palfray lorn
This AleȳnAleyAleȳn al forgat bothe mele and corn
Al was oute of his mynde / his housbandrye
What whilke way is he gane / he gan to crye
The wyfe cam lepyng Inward with a ren
She saide Allas / youre hors goth to the fen
With wilde Mares / as faste as he may go
Vn thank come on hys hond that bond hym soo
And he that bettre sholde haue knyt the reyne
Allas quod Iohn Aleyn for cristes peyne
Ley doun thy swerde / and I wole myn al swa
I is full wight god waat as is a Raa
By godꝭesgodgodꝭes hert he shall nat scape vs bathe
Why ne hadde thow putte thy capul in the lathe
Ilhail by god Aleyn / thou is a fonne
This sely Clerkys / han full faste y ronne
Toward the fen / bothe Aleyn and eke Iohn
And whan the Millere seigh / that they were gon̄
He half a boisshel of hire floure hath take
And bade his wyf goo knede it in a Cake
